title: Manchester City 'will hand Fernandinho a new 12-month deal' amid exit fears
text:
Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is reportedly set to offer Fernandinho a new 12-month contract amid fears he could quit the club next summer.

The Brazilian has deputised at centre-back this season following the summer exit of Vincent Kompany and injuries to Aymeric Laporte and John Stones.

Fernandinho will now sit down with City to thrash out terms for a new deal as Guardiola bids to extend his six-year stay at the Etihad.

Fernandinho will reportedly be offered a new 12-month deal by Manchester City

Fernandinho's experience and versatility has been vital following Vincent Kompany's exit

The 34-year-old has played at centre-back amid a spate of defensive injuries this term

However, it's likely that the 34-year-old will have to take a marginal pay cut on his reported £120,000 a week salary to reflect his advancing years, according to The Sun.

Guardiola is keen to avoid losing yet another experienced player in his dressing room, with midfielder David Silva set to depart next summer.

Fernandinho has become a key player at City since joining the club from Shakhtar Donetsk in 2013, winning the Premier League three times.
description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is reportedly set to offer Fernandinho a new 12-month contract amid fears the veteran could follow David Silva out of the Etihad and quit the club next summer.
